required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Investigating the Concentrations of Darapladib in Blood and the Safety of This Compound in Healthy Japanese Men
clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Single Oral Doses of Darapladib (SB480848) in Healthy Japanese Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being conducted to provide initial safety, tolerability, PK and PD data that will allow further studies with darapladib in Japanese patients

primary_outcome.measure: - Safety/tolerability of single oral doses of darapladib
- Primary Pharmacokinetic parameters of single oral doses of darapladib

secondary_outcome.measure: -Secondary PK parameters -PK parameters of SB553253 -inhibition of Lp-PLA2 activity -description of plasma concentration-Lp-PLA2 activity inhibition relationship after single oral doses of darapladib. all measured same timepoints as primary PK

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Japanese males, 20-64 years of age, inclusive
- Body weight >50Kg
- Body Mass Index (BMI): 18-28
- Subjects must have lived outside of Japan no more than 10 years
- Non-smoker or smokes fewer than 10 cigarettes/day
Exclusion criteria:
- History of asthma, anaphylaxis or anaphylactoid reactions, severe allergic responses
- History of sensitivity to heparin or heparin-induced thrombocytopenia
- History of alcohol/drug abuse or dependence within 12 months of the study
- Positive syphilis, HIV antibody, Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C
- History of cholecystectomy or biliary tract disease or history of liver disease
- Participation in a clinical study within 30 days prior to first dose
- Subject has been exposed to more than 4 chemical entities within 12 months
- Positive urine drug and alcohol at screening
- Subject has any medical history or clinically relevant abnormality that would make the subject ineligible for inclusion due to safety reasons.

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.
